Which means my fam rarely sees the circumstances of their lives depicted without the simultaneous message of: poverty, destitution, punchline etc. There's some truth in that, too, but it elides all the other truths, the many truths that define their lives, both small and large

It is so rare for a trailer park or mobile home to appear in movies/ media without being coded to represent some negative trait or punchline. It's almost never a mundane backdrop, and often serves to underscore some element of character development, rarely affirming, often a joke

@cat_tebaldi Yeah, the wildest thing to me is how easy/commonplace it is for even the most basic elements of how others experience being in the world, at a foundational level, to feel unknowable, inconceivable to us -- yet also for this chasm to feel hidden/obscured/surprising to discover
@postcyborg Yeah! I guess one thing I was surprised to learn is that it's more of a continuum than an on/off thing

@Tiny_Nusquam Same! Weirdly, I find visualization a helpful tool in initially revving down the more language based thoughts. And the zero inner monolog thing is wild to me because I experience/recognize at least 2-3 languistic lines of thought running parallel to each other/about each other!
@Tiny_Nusquam Been asking folks about it more and hearing very similar things!
@HelloJessicaFox That's news to me! I'll look it up! More things to make my mind feel weird about being a mind always welcome

I find it so mind-boggling that my first instinct is to say, maybe the real issue is that language fails us and we miscommunicate about what is actually a much more similar interior experience than we think, but that's gotta just be my own bias/limitation talking
Between that and some folks having no interior monolog (i can barely wrap my mind around this), I'm even more fascinated & curious about the inner experience of other people than I already was!

Could say I just found out I have "hyperphantasia" ("vivid mental imagery," "cinematic" inner visualization, manipulable mental visual objects?), but what I *really* found out is: most people don't experience this?? I knew some don't, but most?? This feels bananas to me

I hear a remake of Time Bandits is in the cards, and I'm hear to say I hope they keep true to what is probably among the darkest and most cynical endings to a children's movie ever put to film (and, not suprisingly, a personal favorite too. Makes me laugh anew every time).

It was about dry cleaners moonlighting as muffin salesman? Scary! For us, it explored weirdness of being alive/trying to do anything (we were kids!), but adults inferred code for drugs? Hoopla illuminated adults' weird fear of young people and the limited imagination of that fear

It's banned books week! In high school, a short one-act play I wrote with friends was so enraging to parents that not only our dumb play but the entire yearly one-act festival itself was almost shuttered for fear of anything similar ever being performed again. Proud moment!
Saw someone ask if a particular rumination on specific mountains was poetry or science, and I was confused because poetry is science, it's the first science.

If you're looking to laugh and feel like shit at the same time (or just looking for a quick weekend read or two, or whichever, you be you), I've rounded up all the new stories I published in the past year. Yay https://t.co/5j9wgY3FJY

(Most of these are collected into my newest book of short stories, one discarded title of which was "Memoir" because of my insistence that all of these stories, or even all stories, really happened/are happening in one way or another)

And, most recently, this piece, "The Big One," about trying to make deliveries, or really just trying to get by, amid disaster and collapse (and also about a mysterious "financial cream" purported to absolve your debts) https://t.co/xpQfMq7nqe

And this index of "Future Lawn Ornaments," which is perhaps more about the way we mediate our relationship to our thoughts and each other, but which I also sort of have no idea how to describe other than to say it is just about lawn ornaments in the future https://t.co/oIXotjtOpE
